definitions.definition: Closed, shut.
Narrow; confined.
At a little distance; near.
Intimate; well-loved.
Oppressive; without motion or ventilation; causing a feeling of lassitude.
(Ireland, England, Scotland) Hot, humid, with no wind.
(of a vowel) Articulated with the tongue body relatively close to the hard palate.
Strictly confined; carefully guarded.
Out of the way of observation; secluded; secret; hidden.
Nearly equal; almost evenly balanced.
Short.
definitions.example: to cut grass or hair close

definitions.definition: Dense; solid; compact.
Concise; to the point.
Difficult to obtain.
Parsimonious; stingy.
Adhering strictly to a standard or original; exact.
Accurate; careful; precise; also, attentive; undeviating; strict.
definitions.example: The patient was kept under close observation.

definitions.definition: Marked, evident.
The act or time of shutting; close.
A door or cover; a shutter.
The line or place where two pieces of metal are welded together.
To close, to stop from being open.
To close, to stop being open.
definitions.example: If you wait too long, the automatic door will shut.

definitions.definition: To close a business temporarily, or (of a business) to be closed.
definitions.example: The pharmacy is shut on Sunday.

definitions.definition: To confine in an enclosed area.
definitions.example: I shut the cat in the kitchen before going out.

definitions.definition: To catch or snag in the act of shutting something.
definitions.example: He's just shut his finger in the door.

definitions.definition: To preclude; to exclude; to bar out.
Closed.
definitions.example: A shut door barred our way into the house.

definitions.definition: A narrow alley or passage acting as a short cut through the buildings between two streets.
